Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2018 08:30PM Saved_by_grace wrote: it is a type of mastectomy that they offer for women with large breasts and take the excess skin and tuck it under and make mini boobs. My surgeon gave me this option. However, some that have it say they absorb and disappear. I am trying to find information about pre pectoral reconstruction also.
Posts.Title: Anyone have a Goldilocks mastectomy? Saved_by_grace Saved_by_grace

Posts.Content: May 8, 2018 03:41AM Saved_by_grace wrote: Hello everyone! I am scheduled for a bilateral mastectomy with immediate over the muscle round silicone implants (nipples will be removed) on May 17th. I won't know until after the pathology results come back , what stage I am. I have been so tired this past year , at least I know why now . I am thankful for this board . üòä
Posts.Title: May 2018 Surgery Support Group ReadyAbout SPDGirl

Posts.Content: May 8, 2018 03:51AM Saved_by_grace wrote: Ready About - I teach special Ed middle schoolers - resource. They are wild this time of year. I have been so surprised at the amount of love they have shown me since my diagnosis. One boy just made state for track and had me sign the toe of his track shoes . ‚ù§Ô∏è I am sad I won't finish the year due to the surgery.
